responses.rationale: Describes an international framework/allocation ('allocates 10% of global supply') as a preparedness measure without active reassurance.
Discusses potential future problems ('much worse problem with vaccine hoarding'). Not a capability statement without reassurance.
Describes 'pandemic plans' and allocation priority ('flu shots should go first') as preparedness measures without active reassurance.
Explicitly states 'Less reassuring'. This is not a capability statement without reassurance.
Describes development efforts ('push among companies to develop a bird flu vaccine') as a capability without active reassurance.
Describes readiness and stockpile ('stand ready to begin production', 'existing H5N1 vaccine strains in stock') as capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
Describes development and testing ('are already developing or about to test sample human vaccines') as capability without active reassurance.
States 'the risk of transmission between humans is still low', which is active reassurance.
Describes the outbreak and its impact ('killed record numbers of birds and infected mammals'). Not a capability statement.
Describes potential production capability ('could make hundreds of millions of bird flu shots') without active reassurance.
States 'avian flu is considered a low risk to humans', which is active reassurance.
Reports where the virus has been found. Not a capability statement.
Describes testing/surveillance ('department will test other flocks') as a capability/preparedness measure without active reassurance.
Describes culling and composting ('was killed and was being composted to guard against spread') as safeguards without active reassurance.
Reports a positive test result and location. Not a capability statement.
Describes culling ('have been culled') as a response measure without active reassurance.
States a fact about the predominant strain. Not a capability statement.
Reports a farm was hit by the virus. Not a capability statement.
Describes culling ('will cull 40,000 laying hens') as a response measure without active reassurance.
Describes impact ('Trading has suffered'). Not a capability statement.
Describes ongoing work ('USDA is working with other countries on options for vaccines') as a capability without active reassurance.
Describes past policy and concern ('worried that importers will ban'). Not a capability statement without reassurance.
Describes ongoing work ('officials were working jointly on additional surveillance and testing') as capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
Describes testing procedures and network ('Samples... were tested', 'National Animal Health Laboratory Network') as capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
Reports new cases and spread. Not a capability statement.
Provides advice as a 'general food safety precaution', which is active reassurance (Rule C).
Mentions 'improved biosecurity on farms' as a factor, which is a preparedness measure, without active reassurance.
Reports outbreaks and warns 'situation could worsen'. Not a capability statement without reassurance.
Reports outbreaks. Not a capability statement.
Reports birds killed due to outbreaks. Not a capability statement.

Describes efforts ('efforts to step up vaccine research and production') as a capability without active reassurance.

Describes pursuing addition/integration ('is pursuing the addition of an mRNA platform', 'integrated into its national pre-pandemic flu vaccine stockpile program') as capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
Reports lack of response. Not a capability statement.
Describes commitment and capability ('remain committed to using our mRNA platform to respond') without active reassurance.
Describes trial status and data expectation ('Dosing is complete in an earlier-stage trial', 'data expected soon') as capability without active reassurance.
Describes discussions ('in discussions with the U.S. government on advancing our pandemic flu candidate') as capability without active reassurance.
Describes potential funding and commitment to purchase ('funding... could total', 'include a commitment to purchase vaccine doses') as capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
Reports potential deal/funding for trial ('government is near a deal to fund a late-stage trial') as capability without active reassurance.
Reports study finding about heat treatment effect ('amount of infectious bird flu virus in raw milk rapidly declines with heat treatment') as a safeguard/capability without active reassurance.
